name: mass
column7: organisms)
column8: Measures the amount of matter in an object. Example: A planet has a mass of 5.972 × 10^24 kg.

name: velocity
column7: Describes the rate of change of position. Example: A car has a velocity of 20 m/s.

name: energy
column7: reactions)
column8: Quantifies the capacity to do work. Example: A photon carries energy of 2.0 × 10^-19 J.

name: charge
column7: Measures electric charge. Example: An electron has a charge of -1.602 × 10^-19 C.

name: temperature
column7: solids)
column8: Indicates thermal energy level. Example: Water boils at a temperature of 373.15 K at standard pressure.

name: concentration
column6: Measures solute amount per unit volume. Example: A saline solution has a concentration of 0.9 mol/L NaCl.

name: pH
column6: Measures acidity or basicity. Example: Lemon juice has a pH of 2.0.

name: wavelength
column7: Distance between wave peaks. Example: Blue light has a wavelength of 450 nm.

name: frequency
column7: Number of wave cycles per second. Example: A radio wave has a frequency of 100 MHz.

name: volume
column7: gases)
column8: Measures space occupied. Example: A container has a volume of 0.001 m³.

name: density
column7: gases)
column8: Mass per unit volume. Example: Water has a density of 1000 kg/m³.

name: atomic_number
column6: Number of protons in an atom’s nucleus. Example: Carbon has an atomic_number of 6.

name: molecular_weight
column6: Mass of one mole of a substance. Example: Water has a molecular_weight of 18.015 g/mol.

name: gene_length
column6: Number of nucleotide base pairs in a gene. Example: The CFTR gene has a gene_length of 250,000 bp.

name: expression_level
column6: Quantifies gene or protein activity. Example: A gene has an expression_level of 5.2 in liver cells.

name: cardinality
column6: Number of elements in a set. Example: The set {1, 2, 3} has a cardinality of 3.

name: dimension
column7: shapes)
column8: Number of independent coordinates. Example: A cube has a dimension of 3.

name: area
column7: Measures surface extent. Example: A rectangle has an area of 12 m².

name: angle
column7: Measures rotation between two rays. Example: A right angle has an angle of π/2 rad.

name: entropy
column7: Measures disorder or uncertainty. Example: A gas system has an entropy of 50 J/K.

name: mutation_rate
description: Frequency of genetic mutations. Example: A gene has a mutation_rate of 10^-8 mutations per generation.

name: cell_size
column7: Physical size of a cell. Example: A red blood cell has a cell_size of 7 µm in diameter.

name: replication_rate
column7: Rate of cell division. Example: E. coli has a replication_rate of 2 cells per hour under optimal conditions.

name: photosynthetic_efficiency
column7: Fraction of light energy converted to chemical energy. Example: A plant has a photosynthetic_efficiency of 0.06.

name: metabolic_rate
column7: Rate of energy expenditure. Example: A human has a metabolic_rate of 100 W at rest.

name: chromosome_number
column6: Number of chromosomes in a cell. Example: Humans have a chromosome_number of 46.

name: electronegativity
column6: Tendency to attract electrons. Example: Fluorine has an electronegativity of 3.98.

name: boiling_point
column7: Temperature at which a substance boils. Example: Water has a boiling_point of 373.15 K.

name: solubility
column7: Amount of solute that dissolves in a solvent. Example: NaCl has a solubility of 360 g/L in water.

name: reaction_rate
description: Speed of a chemical reaction. Example: A reaction has a reaction_rate of 0.01 mol/L/s.

name: bond_dissociation_energy
column6: Energy required to break a bond. Example: The C-H bond has a bond_dissociation_energy of 413 kJ/mol.

name: elevation
column7: Height above sea level. Example: Mount Everest has an elevation of 8,848 m.

name: latitude
column6: Angular distance north or south of the equator. Example: New York City has a latitude of 40.7128° N.

name: longitude
column6: Angular distance east or west of the prime meridian. Example: New York City has a longitude of 74.0060° W.

name: precipitation
column6: Amount of rainfall or snowfall. Example: The Amazon rainforest has a precipitation of 2,000 mm/yr.

name: surface_area
column7: Extent of a surface. Example: Lake Superior has a surface_area of 82,100 km².

name: population_density
column7: Number of people per unit area. Example: Tokyo has a population_density of 6,224 people/km².

name: soil_ph
column6: Acidity or basicity of soil. Example: A farmland has a soil_ph of 6.5.

name: tectonic_plate_velocity
description: Speed of plate movement. Example: The Pacific Plate has a tectonic_plate_velocity of 7 cm/yr.
